overview.description: Assam, located in northeastern India, is famous for its lush tea plantations, one-horned rhinoceros, and the mighty Brahmaputra River. Becoming a state on January 26, 1950, it is a gateway to the Northeast with a rich cultural heritage and natural beauty.

top_destinations.name: Kaziranga National Park
top_destinations.description: A UNESCO site famous for the one-horned rhinoceros and elephant safaris.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Book jeep safari in advance; carry binoculars.

top_destinations.name: Guwahati
top_destinations.description: The gateway city with the Kamakhya Temple and scenic Brahmaputra River.

top_destinations.name: Majuli Island
top_destinations.description: The world’s largest river island known for its satras and culture.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Take a ferry; explore by bicycle.

accommodation.name: Wild Grass Lodge
accommodation.description: Luxurious stay near Kaziranga National Park.

accommodation.name: Vivanta Guwahati
accommodation.description: Premium hotel with river views in Guwahati.

culinary_delights.name: Khaugiri Restaurant
culinary_delights.description: Best spot for fresh river fish dishes.

culinary_delights.name: Momo Ghar
culinary_delights.description: Popular for momos and local snacks.

culinary_delights.name: Dynasty
culinary_delights.description: Variety of Indian and Chinese dishes.

culinary_delights.name: Cafe B-You
culinary_delights.description: Cozy spot for coffee and pastries.

must_visit_spots.name: Kamakhya Temple
must_visit_spots.description: One of the most sacred Shakti Peethas in India.
must_visit_spots.tip: Visit during Ambubachi Mela for a unique experience.

must_visit_spots.name: Manas National Park
must_visit_spots.description: A UNESCO site with tigers, elephants, and diverse wildlife.
must_visit_spots.tip: Opt for an elephant safari for a closer view.

must_visit_spots.name: Tezpur
must_visit_spots.description: A historic town with scenic riverside and ruins.
must_visit_spots.tip: Explore Agnigarh Hill for panoramic views.

must_visit_spots.name: Hajo
must_visit_spots.description: A pilgrimage site for Hindus, Muslims, and Buddhists.

must_visit_spots.name: Sivasagar
must_visit_spots.description: Known for its ancient Ahom monuments and temples.
must_visit_spots.tip: Check out Rang Ghar, an amphitheater.

must_visit_spots.name: Jorhat
must_visit_spots.description: Tea capital with lush estates and cultural heritage.
must_visit_spots.tip: Tour a tea garden for an authentic experience.

travel_essentials.how_to_reach: By road: Guwahati is 100 km from Shillong (NH27, 3-4 hrs). By train: Guwahati Junction connects major cities. By air: Lokpriya Gopinath Bordoloi Airport (Guwahati).
travel_essentials.tips: Carry light rain gear; respect local festivals.
